sentences.en: Affecting nonchalance, I handed her two hundred dollar bills.
sentences.cn: 我装作一副无动于衷的样子，递给她200美元钞票。

sentences.en: He insists any tax cut be matched dollar-for-dollar with cuts in spending.
sentences.cn: 他坚持每一项减税都要和支出削减一一对应。

sentences.en: I'd &B{bet dollars }to &B{doughnuts} he's a medical student.
sentences.cn: 我敢打赌他是个医科学生。

sentences.en: In early trading in Tokyo, the dollar fell sharply against the yen.
sentences.cn: 在东京市场早市开盘时，美元对日元的比价急剧下跌。

sentences.en: Many analysts think the dollar is on an uptrend.
sentences.cn: 很多分析家认为美元走势坚挺。

sentences.en: On the foreign exchanges, the US dollar is up point forty-five.
sentences.cn: 在外汇交易中，美元上涨了0.45个百分点。

sentences.en: On the money markets the dollar was weaker against European currencies.
sentences.cn: 在货币市场上，美元不如欧洲货币坚挺。

sentences.en: People will always pay top dollar for something exclusive.
sentences.cn: 人们总是会为绝无仅有的东西付出高价。

sentences.en: The American dollar finished the day up against foreign currencies.
sentences.cn: 美元汇率今日收盘时有所上涨。

sentences.en: The dollar fell to within a hair's breadth of its all-time low.
sentences.cn: 美元差一点跌到了最低点。

sentences.en: The dollar's recent strength is crimping overseas sales and profits.
sentences.cn: 美元最近的坚挺影响了国外的销量和利润。

sentences.en: The drop was caused partly by the pound's strength against the dollar.
sentences.cn: 下降的部分原因在于英镑对美元的升值。

sentences.en: The US dollar continued its strong performance in Tokyo today.
sentences.cn: 美元今天在东京继续保持强劲的走势。

sentences.en: The US dollar is down against most foreign currencies today.
sentences.cn: 今天美元对大多数外汇的比价都有所下降。

sentences.en: They noticed fifty and twenty dollar bills floating in the water.
sentences.cn: 他们发现水中漂浮着50和20美元的纸币。

sentences.en: Until now, a devaluation of the dollar seemed inconceivable.
sentences.cn: 直到现在，美元的贬值似乎都无法想象。

sentences.en: You can pay in dollars or euros at the airport.
sentences.cn: 在机场你可以使用美元或欧元。

trans.tran_cn: 元（美国等国的货币单位），一元（纸币或硬币）
trans.tran_en: the standard unit of money in the US, Canada, Australia, and some other countries, divided into 100  cent s  : symbol $
the standard unit of money in the US, Canada, Australia, and some other countries, divided into 100  cent s  : symbol $
